children.comments: Creates a vector from two components
children.title: Vec

declarations.comments: Polymorphic 2D vector
declarations.title: Vec

declarations.comments: Creates a vector from two components
declarations.title: vec

declarations.comments:
Vector with X value `one` and Y value `zero`.

In analogy to the existing `Semiring` methods `one` and `zero` for `Vec`

```
> oneX + oneY == one
true
```
declarations.title: oneX

declarations.comments:
Vector with X value `zero` and Y value `one`.

In analogy to the existing `Semiring` methods `one` and `zero` for `Vec`.

```
> oneX + oneY == one
true
```
declarations.title: oneY

declarations.comments:
Pattern match on a vector by providing a reducer function

```
> unVec (+) (Vec 1 2)
3
```
declarations.title: unVec

declarations.comments:
Retrieves the X component of a vector

```
> getX (Vec 1 2)
1
```
declarations.title: getX

declarations.comments:
Retrieves the Y component of a vector

```
> getY (Vec 1 2)
2
```
declarations.title: getY

declarations.comments:
Exchanges the X and Y component of a vector

```
> swap (Vec 1 2)
Vec 2 1
```
declarations.title: swap

declarations.comments:
Divides two vectors componentwise.
This exists because there cannot be an `EuclideanRing` instance for `Vec`

```
> vdiv (Vec 9 6) (Vec 3 2)
Vec 3 3
```
declarations.title: vdiv

declarations.comments:
Componentwise Modulo operation
This exists because there cannot be an `EuclideanRing` instance for `Vec`

```
> mod (Vec 12 120) (Vec 120 100)
Vec 2 20
```
declarations.title: vmod

declarations.comments:
Halves the amount of each component

```
> half (Vec 10 100)
Vec 5 50
```
declarations.title: half

declarations.comments:
Duplicates the amount of each component

```
> twice (Vec 10 100)
Vec 20 200
```
declarations.title: twice

declarations.comments:
Sets the X component of a vector

```
> setX "C" (Vec "A" "B")
Vec "C" "B"
```
declarations.title: setX

declarations.comments:
Sets the Y component of a vector

```
> setY "C" (Vec "A" "B")
Vec "A" "C"
```
declarations.title: setY

declarations.comments:
Modifies the X component of a vector

```
> modifyX (add 10) (Vec 3 4)
Vec 13 4
```
declarations.title: modifyX

declarations.comments:
Modifies the Y component of a vector

```
> modifyY (add 10) (Vec 3 4)
Vec 3 14
```
declarations.title: modifyY

declarations.comments: A Lens on the X component of a vector
declarations.title: _x

declarations.comments: A Lens on the Y component of a vector
declarations.title: _y

children.comments: Creates a vector from three components
children.title: Vec

declarations.comments: Polymorphic 3D vector
declarations.title: Vec

declarations.comments: Creates a vector from two components
declarations.title: vec

declarations.comments:
Vector with Y value `one` and other values `zero`.

In analogy to the existing `Semiring` methods `one` and `zero` for `Vec`.

```
> oneX + oneY + oneZ == one
true
```
declarations.title: oneX

declarations.comments:
Vector with Z value `one` and other values `zero`.

In analogy to the existing `Semiring` methods `one` and `zero` for `Vec`

```
> oneX + oneY + oneZ == one
true
```
declarations.title: oneY

declarations.comments:
Vector with X value `one` and other values `zero`.

In analogy to the existing `Semiring` methods `one` and `zero` for `Vec`

```
> oneX + oneY + oneZ == one
true
```
declarations.title: oneZ

declarations.comments:
Pattern match on a vector by providing a reducer function

```
> unVec (\x y z -> x <> y <> z) (Vec "1" "2" "3")
"123"
```
declarations.title: unVec

declarations.comments:
Retrieves the X component of a vector

```
> getX (Vec 1 2 3)
1
```
declarations.title: getX

declarations.comments:
Retrieves the Y component of a vector

```
> getY (Vec 1 2 3)
2
```
declarations.title: getY

declarations.comments:
Retrieves the Z component of a vector

```
> getZ (Vec 1 2 3)
3
```
declarations.title: getZ

declarations.comments:
Rotates the components of the vector to the right

```
> rotRight (Vec 1 2 3)
Vec 3 1 2
```
declarations.title: rotRight

declarations.comments:
Rotates the components of the vector to the left

```
> rotRight (Vec 1 2 3)
Vec 2 3 1
```
declarations.title: rotLeft

declarations.comments:
Divides two vectors componentwise.
This exists because there cannot be an `EuclideanRing` instance for `Vec`

```
> vdiv (Vec 9 6 4) (Vec 3 2 4)
Vec 3 3 1
```
declarations.title: vdiv

declarations.comments:
Componentwise Modulo operation
This exists because there cannot be an `EuclideanRing` instance for `Vec`

```
> mod (Vec 12 120 1200) (Vec 120 100 1000)
Vec 2 20 200
```
declarations.title: vmod

declarations.comments:
Halves the amount of each component

```
> half (Vec 10 100 1000)
Vec 5 50 500
```
declarations.title: half

declarations.comments:
Duplicates the amount of each component

```
> twice (Vec 10 100 1000)
Vec 20 200 2000
```
declarations.title: twice

declarations.comments:
Sets the X component of a vector

```
> setX "G" (Vec "A" "B" "C")
Vec "G" "B" "C"
```
declarations.title: setX

declarations.comments:
Sets the Y component of a vector

```
> setY "G" (Vec "A" "B" "C")
Vec "A" "G" "C"
```
declarations.title: setY

declarations.comments:
Sets the Z component of a vector

```
> setZ "G" (Vec "A" "B" "C")
Vec "A" "B" "G"
```
declarations.title: setZ

declarations.comments:
Modifies the X component of a vector

```
> modifyX (add 10) (Vec 3 4 2)
Vec 13 4 2
```
declarations.title: modifyX

declarations.comments:
Modifies the Y component of a vector

```
> modifyY (add 10) (Vec 3 4 2)
Vec 3 14 2
```
declarations.title: modifyY

declarations.comments:
Modifies the Z component of a vector

```
> modifyZ (add 10) (Vec 3 4 2)
Vec 3 4 20
```
declarations.title: modifyZ

declarations.comments: A Lens on the X component of a vector
declarations.title: _x

declarations.comments: A Lens on the Y component of a vector
declarations.title: _y

declarations.comments: A Lens on the Z component of a vector
declarations.title: _z

modules.name: Data.Vector3
